function.name: draggable
function.desc: Creates new draggables on the nodeset supplied by the query.
function.longdesc: This jQuery plugin makes DOM nodes draggable by mouse. You can additionally supply a great range of options to make them fit your needs.

params.name: options
params.desc: A set of key/value pairs that configure the draggable. All options are optional.

option.name: appendTo
option.desc: The string should be a jQuery selector. The matched element will be used as the helper's container. If not specified, the helper is appended to the same container as the draggable.

option.name: axis
option.desc: Constrains dragging to either the horizontal (x) or vertical (y) axis. Cannot be used with cursorAt. Possible values: 'x', 'y'.

option.name: containment
option.desc: Constrains dragging to within the bounds of the specified element - can be a DOM element, 'parent', 'document' or a jQuery selector.

option.name: cursor
option.desc: The css cursor for the helper during the drag operation.

option.name: cursorAt
option.desc: Moves the dragging element/helper so the cursor always appears to drag from the same position.

option.name: dragPrevention
option.desc: Prevents dragging if you start on elements of the specified type(s). Default: ['input', 'textarea', 'button', 'select', 'option'].

option.name: effect
option.desc: The effects for the drag start and stop. Possible values [Start, Stop]: 'fade' (Start - fade in, Stop - fade out)

option.name: grid
option.desc: Snaps the dragging element/helper to a grid, every x and y pixels. Cannot be used with cursorAt.

option.name: handle
option.desc: Restricts drag start click to the specified element. Default value: draggable element.

option.name: helper
option.desc: Allows for a helper element to be used for dragging display. The supplied function should return a valid DOM node to be used as a custom proxy helper.

option.name: helper
option.desc: Allows for a helper element to be used for dragging display. The 'clone' option will produce the 'ghosting' effect. Possible values: 'original', 'clone', Function. Default value: 'original'.

option.name: opacity
option.desc: Opacity for element/helper while being dragged.

option.name: preventionDistance
option.desc: Tolerance for when dragging should start. If specified, dragging will not start until after mouse is dragged beyond distance.

option.name: preventionTimeout
option.desc: Time in milliseconds to define when the dragging should start. It helps preventing unwanted drags when clicking on an element. Default value: false

option.name: revert
option.desc: If true, the element will return to its start position when dragging stops.

option.name: scroll
option.desc: If true, container auto-scrolls while dragging. Default value: true.

option.name: scrollSensitivity
option.desc: Default value: 20.

option.name: scrollSpeed
option.desc: Default value: 20.

option.name: zIndex
option.desc: z-index for element/helper while being dragged.

option.name: start
option.desc: Function to call when dragging starts.

option.name: drag
option.desc: Function to call when the mouse is moved during the dragging. ui.position.left and ui.position.top give the position.

option.name: stop
option.desc: Function to call when dragging stops. ui.position.left and ui.position.top give the position.

example.desc: Makes the div draggable.

function.name: draggableInstance
function.desc: Returns the OO instance of the current draggable.
function.longdesc: For the advanced, this function is very useful to modify internals of the draggables after initializing it. It returns a javascript function instance.

function.name: draggableDestroy
function.desc: Destroys all draggable functionality in the current jQuery.
function.longdesc: Destroys all draggable functionality in the current jQuery.

function.name: draggableEnable
function.desc: Enables draggables.
function.longdesc: Re-enables draggable functionality on the jQuery supplied that has been disabled before.

function.name: draggableDisable
function.desc: Disables draggables.
function.longdesc: Temporarily disables draggables on the current jQuery. Can be re-enabled again later on.

function.name: droppable
function.desc: Creates new droppables on the nodeset supplied by the query.
function.longdesc: This jQuery plugin makes DOM nodes droppable (meaning they accept being dropped on by draggables). You can specify which (individually) or which kind of draggables each will accept.

params.name: options
params.desc: A set of key/value pairs that configure the droppable. All options are optional.

option.name: accept
option.desc: This function is called for each draggable on the page, to provide a custom filter. Return true if draggable should be accepted.

option.name: accept
option.desc: The string should be a jQuery selector. All draggables that match the selector will be accepted.

option.name: activeClass
option.desc: The class that should be added to the droppable while an acceptable draggable is being dragged.

option.name: greedy
option.desc: If true, will prevent event propagation on nested droppables. Default value: false.

option.name: hoverClass
option.desc: The class that should be added to the droppable while being hovered by an acceptable draggable.

option.name: tolerance
option.desc: Specifies which mode to use for testing whether a draggable is 'over' a droppable. Possible values: 'fit', 'intersect', 'pointer', 'touch'. Default value: 'intersect'.

option.name: activate
option.desc: This function is called any time an accepted draggable starts dragging.

option.name: deactivate
option.desc: This function is called any time an accepted draggable stops dragging.

option.name: over
option.desc: This function is called as an accepted draggable is dragged 'over' (within the tolerance of) this droppable.

option.name: out
option.desc: This function is called when an accepted draggable is dragged out (within the tolerance of) this droppable.

option.name: drop
option.desc: This function is called when an accepted draggable is dropped 'over' (within the tolerance of) this droppable.

example.desc: Makes the div drag and droppable.

function.name: droppableInstance
function.desc: Returns the OO instance of the current droppable.
function.longdesc: For the advanced, this function is very useful to modify internals of the droppables after initializing it. It returns a javascript function instance.

function.name: droppableDestroy
function.desc: Destroys all droppable functionality in the current jQuery.
function.longdesc: Destroys all droppable functionality in the current jQuery.

function.name: droppableEnable
function.desc: Enables droppables.
function.longdesc: Re-enables droppable functionality on the jQuery supplied that has been disabled before.

function.name: droppableDisable
function.desc: Disables droppables.
function.longdesc: Temporarily disables droppables on the current jQuery. Can be re-enabled again later on.

function.name: sortable
function.desc: Creates new sortable on the nodeset supplied by the query.
function.longdesc: This jQuery plugin makes DOM nodes sortable by mouse. You can additionally supply a great range of options to make them fit your needs.

params.name: options
params.desc: A set of key/value pairs that configure the sortable. All options are optional.

option.name: items
option.desc: Items to apply sorting to.

option.name: helper
option.desc: Allows for a helper element to be used for dragging display. The supplied function should return a valid DOM node to be used as a custom proxy helper.

option.name: containment
option.desc: Constrains dragging to within the bounds of the specified element. Possible values: 'parent', 'document', jQuery String.

option.name: zIndex
option.desc: z-index for element/helper while being sorted.

option.name: hoverClass
option.desc: Class that gets applied to the otherwise white space.

option.name: start
option.desc: Function to call when sorting starts.

option.name: stop
option.desc: Function to call when sorting stops.

option.name: update
option.desc: Function to call when the user stopped sorting and something has changed.

option.name: sort
option.desc: Function to call during sorting.

option.name: change
option.desc: Function to call during sorting, when something changed.

example.desc: Basic Example of a sortable.
example.css: ul { list-style: none; } li { background: #727EA3; color: #FFF; width: 100px; margin: 5px; font-size: 10px; font-family: Arial; padding: 3px; }

function.name: sortableDestroy
function.desc: Destroys all sortable functionality in the current jQuery.

function.name: selectable
function.desc: Creates new selectable on the nodeset supplied by the query.

params.name: options
params.desc: A set of key/value pairs that configure the selectable. All options are optional.

option.name: filter
option.desc: The matching child elements will be made selectees (able to be selected). Default value: '*'

option.name: selected
option.desc: This callback is fired at the end of the select operation, on each element added to the selection.

option.name: selecting
option.desc: This callback is fired during the select operation, on each element added to the selection.

option.name: unselected
option.desc: This callback is fired at the end of the select operation, on each element removed from the selection.

option.name: unselecting
option.desc: This callback is fired during the select operation, on each element removed from the selection.

example.desc: Basic Example of a selectable. (Draw a box with your mouse to select items.)

function.name: resizable
function.desc: Creates new resizables on the nodeset supplied by the query.
function.longdesc: This jQuery plugin makes DOM nodes resizable (meaning they have draggable resize handles). You can specify one or more handles as well as min and max width and height.

params.name: options
params.desc: A set of key/value pairs that configure the resizable. All options are optional, but a resizable will not be useful without at least one handle.

option.name: handles
option.type: {n, e, s, w, ne, se, sw, nw}
option.desc: Each handle string (if specified) should be a jquery selector matching the child element of the resizable to use as the handle. If the handle is not a child of the resizable, you can pass in the DOM node or a valid jQuery object directly.

option.name: containment
option.desc: Constrains resizing to within the bounds of the specified element - can be a DOM element, 'parent', 'document' or a jQuery selector.

option.name: maxHeight
option.desc: This is the maximum height the resizable should be allowed to resize to.

option.name: maxWidth
option.desc: This is the maximum width the resizable should be allowed to resize to.

option.name: minHeight
option.desc: This is the minimum height the resizable should be allowed to resize to.

option.name: minWidth
option.desc: This is the minimum width the resizable should be allowed to resize to.

option.name: proxy
option.desc: This is the css class that will be added to a proxy element to outline the resize during the drag of the resize handle. Once the resize is complete, the element is sized.

option.name: destructive
option.desc: Largely internal option. For elements that cannot have childnodes, it creates a wrapper div and all handles by itself, allowing to still control them via css. Try doing $('textarea').resizable() for an example.

option.name: proportionallyResize
option.desc: Advanced option that allows other elements to get proportionally resized together with the original one. Just specify jquery string in this array or directly insert DOM nodes.

option.name: start
option.desc: This function is called at the start of a resize operation.

option.name: resize
option.desc: This function is called during the resize, on the drag of the resize handler.

option.name: stop
option.desc: This function is called at the end of a resize operation.

example.desc: A simple jQuery UI Resizable.
example.html: Resize me

function.name: resizableInstance
function.desc: Returns the OO instance of the current resizable.
function.longdesc: For the advanced, this function is very useful to modify internals of the resizable after initializing it. It returns a javascript function instance.

function.name: resizableDestroy
function.desc: Destroys all resizing functionality in the current jQuery.
function.longdesc: Destroys all resizing functionality in the current jQuery.

function.name: resizableEnable
function.desc: Enables resizing.
function.longdesc: Re-enables resizing functionality on the jQuery supplied that has been disabled before.

function.name: resizableDisable
function.desc: Disables resizing.
function.longdesc: Temporarily disables resizing on the current jQuery. Can be re-enabled again later on.

function.name: accordion
function.desc: Make the selected elements Accordion widgets.
function.longdesc:
Semantic requirements:
If the structure of your container is flat with unique tags for header and content elements, eg. a definition list (dl > dt + dd), you don't have to specify any options at all.
If your structure uses the same elements for header and content or uses some kind of nested structure, you have to specify the header elements, eg. via class, see the second example.
Use activate(Number) to change the active content programmatically.
A change event is triggered everytime the accordion changes. Apart from the event object, all arguments are jQuery objects. Arguments: event, newHeader, oldHeader, newContent, oldContent

params.name: options
params.desc: A set of key/value pairs that configure the accordion. All options are optional.

option.name: header
option.desc: Selector for the header element.

option.name: active
option.desc: Selector for the active element. Set to false to display none at start.

option.name: selectedClass
option.desc: Class for active header elements.

option.name: alwaysOpen
option.desc: Whether there must be one content element open.

option.name: animated
option.desc: Choose your favorite animation, or disable them (set to false). In addition to the default, "bounceslide" and "easeslide" are supported (both require the easing plugin).

option.name: event
option.desc: The event on which to trigger the accordion.

option.name: navigation
option.desc: If set, looks for the anchor that matches location.href and activates it. Great for href-based state-saving.

option.name: autoheight
option.desc: If set, the highest content part is used as height reference for all other parts. Provides more consistent animations.

option.name: clearStyle
option.desc: If set, clears height and overflow styles after finishing animations. This enables accordions to work with dynamic content. Won't work together with autoheight.

example.desc: A simple jQuery UI Accordion.
example.html:
• Test 1
    Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat. Duis aute irure dolor in reprehenderit in voluptate velit esse cillum dolore eu fugiat nulla pariatur. Excepteur sint occaecat cupidatat non proident, sunt in culpa qui officia deserunt mollit anim id est laborum.
  • Test 2
    Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat. Duis aute irure dolor in reprehenderit in voluptate velit esse cillum dolore eu fugiat nulla pariatur. Excepteur sint occaecat cupidatat non proident, sunt in culpa qui officia deserunt mollit anim id est laborum.
  • Test 3
    Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat. Duis aute irure dolor in reprehenderit in voluptate velit esse cillum dolore eu fugiat nulla pariatur. Excepteur sint occaecat cupidatat non proident, sunt in culpa qui officia deserunt mollit anim id est laborum.

function.name: activate
function.desc: Activate a content part of the Accordion programmatically.
function.longdesc: The index can be a zero-indexed number to match the position of the header to close or a string expression matching an element. Pass -1 to close all (only possible with alwaysOpen:false).

params.name: index
params.desc: An Integer specifying the zero-based index of the content to be activated or an expression specifying the element, or an element/jQuery object, or a boolean false to close all.

example.desc: Activate the second content of the Accordion contained in <div id="accordion">.
Close all content parts of the accordion.
Activate the first element matching the given expression.

function.name: datepicker
function.desc: The method that you use to create a new date picker. Customize with plenty of options.
function.longdesc: Attach the date picker to an input or for an inline view attach the date picker to a div or span.

params.name: options
params.desc: A set of key/value pairs that configure the date picker. All options are optional.

option.name: clearText
option.desc: The text to display for the clear link. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes.

option.name: closeText
option.desc: The text to display for the close link. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes.

option.name: closeAtTop
option.desc: Position the Clear/Close links at the top (true) or bottom (false).

option.name: prevText
option.desc: The text to display for the previous month link. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes.

option.name: nextText
option.desc: The text to display for the next month link. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes.

option.name: hideIfNoPrevNext
option.desc: Normally the previous and next links are disabled when not applicable (see ''minDate''/''maxDate''). You can hide them altogether by setting this attribute to true.

option.name: currentText
option.desc: The text to display for the current day link. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes.

option.name: monthNames
option.desc: The list of full month names, as used in the month header on each datepicker and as requested via the ''dateFormat'' setting. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes.

option.name: monthNamesShort
option.desc:
The list of abbreviated month names, for use as requested via the ''dateFormat'' setting. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes.
'''Since v3.1.'''

option.name: changeMonth
option.desc: Allows you to change the month by selecting from a drop-down list. You can disable this feature by setting the attribute to false.

option.name: yearRange
option.desc: Control the range of years displayed in the year drop-down: either relative to current year (-nn:+nn) or absolute (nnnn:nnnn).

option.name: changeYear
option.desc: Allows you to change the year by selecting from a drop-down list. You can disable this feature by setting the attribute to false.

option.name: weekHeader
option.desc:
The column header for the week of the year (see ''showWeeks''). This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes.
'''Since v3.1.'''

option.name: dayNames
option.desc:
The list of long day names, starting from Sunday, for use as requested via the ''dateFormat'' setting. They also appear as popup hints when hovering over the corresponding column headings. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes.
'''In v3.0''', this setting held the column headings.

option.name: dayNamesShort
option.desc:
The list of abbreviated day names, starting from Sunday, for use as requested via the ''dateFormat'' setting. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes.
'''Since v3.1.'''

option.name: dayNamesMin
option.desc:
The list of minimised day names, starting from Sunday, for use as column headers within the datepicker. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes.
'''Since v3.1.'''

option.name: firstDay
option.desc: Set the first day of the week: Sunday is 0, Monday is 1, ... This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes.

option.name: changeFirstDay
option.desc: Allows you to click on the day names to have the week start on that day. You can disable this feature by setting the attribute to false.

option.name: showOtherMonths
option.desc: Display dates in other months (non-selectable) at the start or end of the current month.

option.name: showWeeks
option.desc:
Display the week of the year alongside each month. The column header is specified by the ''weekHeader'' setting. The week number is calculated based on the first date shown in each row in the datepicker, and so may not apply to all days in that row. The ''calculateWeek'' setting allows you to change the week of the year calculation from the default ISO 8601 implementation.
'''Since v3.1.'''

option.name: calculateWeek
option.desc:
Perform the week of the year calculation. This function accepts a Date as a parameter and returns the number of the corresponding week of the year. The default implementation uses the ISO 8601 definition of a week: weeks start on a Monday and the first week of the year contains January 4. This means that up to three days from the previous year may be included in the first week of the current year, and that up to three days from the current year may be included in the last week of the previous year.
'''Since v3.1.'''

option.name: numberOfMonths
option.desc: Set how many months to show at once. The value can be a straight integer, or can be a two-element array to define the number of rows and columns to display.

option.name: stepMonths
option.desc: Set how many months to move when clicking the Previous/Next links.

option.name: rangeSelect
option.desc: Set to true to allow the selection of a date range on the one date picker, or false to just select a single date. For a date range, the first click sets the start date and a second click sets the end date.

option.name: rangeSeparator
option.desc: Set the text to use to separate the two dates in a date range via the ''onSelect'' function.

option.name: defaultDate
option.desc: Set the date to display on first opening if the field is blank. Specify either an actual date via a Date object, or relative to today with a number, or null for today.

option.name: minDate
option.desc: Set a minimum selectable date, or null for no limit.

option.name: maxDate
option.desc: Set a maximum selectable date, or null for no limit.

option.name: dateFormat
option.desc:
The format for parsed and displayed dates. This attribute is one of the regionalisation attributes.
'''In v3.0''', the first three characters are 'D' (day), 'M' (month), and 'Y' (year) in the required order, and the fourth is the separator, e.g. ISO would be 'YMD-', default was 'MDY/'.
'''From v3.1''', the format is combinations of the following: * d - day of month (no leading zero) * dd - day of month (two digits) * m - month (no leading zero) * mm - month (two digits) * y - year (two digits) * yy - year (four digits) * D - name of day (short) * DD - name of day (long) * M - name of month (short) * MM - name of month (long) * '...' - literal text * '' - single quote * anything else - literal text

option.name: useShortYear
option.desc:
Set to true to display the year as two digits only, or false to show all four digits.
'''Removed in v3.1.''' Use expanded ''dateFormat'' instead.

option.name: shortYearCutoff
option.desc: Set the cutoff year for determining the century for a date (used in conjunction with ''dateFormat'' 'y'). If a numeric value (0-99) is provided then this value is used directly. If a string value is provided then it is converted to a number and added to the current year. Once the cutoff year is calculated, any dates entered with a year value less than or equal to it are considered to be in the current century, while those greater than it are deemed to be in the previous century.

option.name: appendText
option.desc: The text to display after each date field, e.g. to show the required format.

option.name: speed
option.desc: Control the speed at which the datepicker appears, it may be a time in milliseconds, a descriptive name ('slow', 'medium', 'fast'), or '' for immediately.

option.name: showOn
option.desc: Have the datepicker appear automatically when the field receives focus ('focus'), appear only when a button is clicked ('button'), or appear when either event takes place ('both').

option.name: buttonText
option.desc: The text to display on the trigger button. Use in conjunction with ''showOn'' equal to 'button' or 'both'.

option.name: buttonImage
option.desc: The URL for the popup button image. If set, button text becomes the ''alt'' value and is not directly displayed.

option.name: buttonImageOnly
option.desc: Set to true to place an image after the field to use as the trigger without it appearing on a button.

option.name: beforeShow
option.desc: Can be a function that takes an input field and current datepicker instance and returns a settings (anonymous) object to update the date picker with. It is called just before the datepicker is displayed.

option.name: beforeShowDay
option.desc: The function takes a date as a parameter and must return an array with [0] equal to true/false indicating whether or not this date is selectable and [1] equal to a CSS class name(s) or '' for the default presentation. It is called for each day in the datepicker before is it displayed.

option.name: onSelect
option.desc: Allows you to define your own event when the datepicker is selected. The function receives the selected date as text and the datepicker instance as parameters.

example.desc: A simple jQuery UI Datepicker.
example.html:
<link rel="stylesheet" href="http://dev.jquery.com/view/trunk/themes/flora/flora.datepicker.css" type="text/css" media="screen" title="Flora (Default)">
<script src="http://dev.jquery.com/view/trunk/ui/current/datepicker/core/ui.datepicker.js"></script> <input type="text" id="example" value="Click inside me to see a datepicker" style="width:300px;"/>
<input type="text" id="exampleRange" value="A range datepicker starting on Monday" style="width:300px;"/>

example.desc: Add a datepicker that appears on focus or a click on an icon.
Add a datepicker that doesn't allow selection of days on weekends.
Add a datepicker that defaults to 7 days in the future.
Add a datepicker in French. Requires loading of the French localization package.

function.name: dialogDatepicker
function.desc: Open a datepicker in a "dialog" box.

params.name: dateText
params.desc: The initial date for the date picker.

params.name: onSelect
params.desc: A callback function when a date is selected. The function receives the date text and date picker instance as parameters.

params.name: settings
params.desc: The new settings for the date picker.

params.name: pos
params.desc: The position of the top/left of the dialog as [x, y] or a MouseEvent that contains the coordinates. If not specified the dialog is centered on the screen.

example.desc: Open a datepicker in a "dialog" box.

function.name: disableFor
function.desc: Disable an input field and its attached date picker.

params.name: target
params.desc: The input field to which the date picker is attached, or a selector for the input fields, or an existing jQuery collection.

example.desc: Disable the date picker for an input field.

function.name: enableFor
function.desc: Enable an input field and its attached date picker.

params.name: target
params.desc: The input field to which the date picker is attached, or a selector for the input fields, or an existing jQuery collection.

example.desc: Enable the date picker for an input field.

function.name: getDateFor
function.desc: Retrieve the current date from the date picker attached to an input field.
function.longdesc: If the date picker has rangeSelect set to true, then a two-element array of dates is returned denoting the start and end of the range.

params.name: control
params.desc: The input field, division or span to which the date picker is attached, or a selector for the input field, or an existing jQuery collection. In the latter two cases only the first element in the collection is used.

example.desc: Retrieve the date for an input field.

function.name: hideDatepicker
function.desc: Close a previously opened date picker.

params.name: speed
params.desc: The speed at which to close the date picker (optional).

example.desc: Close the opened date picker.

function.name: isDisabled
function.desc: Determine whether or not an input field has been disabled for the date picker.

params.name: input
params.desc: The input field to which the date picker is attached, or a selector for the input field, or an existing jQuery collection. In the latter two cases only the first element in the collection is used.

example.desc: Retrieve the date for an input field.

function.name: reconfigureFor
function.desc: Change the settings for a previously attached date picker.

params.name: control
params.desc: The input field, division or span to which the date picker is attached, or a jQuery selector for these fields, or an existing jQuery collection.

params.name: settings
params.desc: The new settings for these date pickers.

example.desc: Reconfigure the date picker for an input field - changing its opening speed.

function.name: setDateFor
function.desc: Set the current date for the date picker attached to an input field.

params.name: control
params.desc: The input field, division or span to which the date picker is attached, or a selector for the input field, or an existing jQuery collection. In the latter two cases only the first element in the collection is used.

params.name: date
params.desc: The new date value (starting date for a date range).

params.name: endDate
params.desc: The new end date value for a date range (optional).

example.desc: Set the date for an input field.
Set the date for a date range input field.

function.name: setDefaults
function.desc: Change the default settings for all date pickers

params.name: settings
params.desc: The new settings for all date pickers. See the datepicker options.

example.desc: Set all date pickers to open on focus or a click on an icon.
Set all date pickers to have French text.

function.name: showFor
function.desc: Call up a previously attached date picker.

params.name: target
params.desc: The input field to which the date picker is attached, or a selector for the input field, or an existing jQuery collection. In the latter two cases only the first element in the collection is used.

example.desc: Bring up the date picker for an input field.

function.name: parseDate
function.desc: Extract a date from a string value with a specified format.
function.longdesc: The format can be combinations of the following: * d - day of month (no leading zero) * dd - day of month (two digit) * D - day name short * DD - day name long * m - month of year (no leading zero) * mm - month of year (two digit) * M - month name short * MM - month name long * y - year (two digit) * yy - year (four digit) * '...' - literal text * '' - single quote * anything else - literal text A number of exceptions may be thrown: * 'Invalid arguments' if either ''format'' or ''value'' is null * 'Missing number at position nn' if ''format'' indicated a numeric value that is not then found * 'Unknown name at position nn' if ''format'' indicated day or month name that is not then found * 'Unexpected literal at position nn' if ''format'' indicated a literal value that is not then found * 'Invalid date' if the date is invalid, such as '31/02/2007' '''Since v3.1.'''

params.name: format
params.desc: The format to use in extracting the date.

params.name: value
params.desc: The date value to be examined.

params.name: shortYearCutoff
params.desc: The value (0-99) beyond which years are considered to be in the previous century. Used in conjunction with the 'y' format option. Defaults to the datepicker default which is usually 10 years in the future.

params.name: dayNamesShort
params.desc: The short names for the days of the week, starting at Sunday (optional). Defaults to the datepicker default which is usually standard English.

params.name: dayNames
params.desc: The long names for the days of the week, starting at Sunday (optional). Defaults to the datepicker default which is usually standard English.

params.name: monthNamesShort
params.desc: The short names for the months of the year (optional). Defaults to the datepicker default which is usually standard English.

params.name: monthNames
params.desc: The long names for the months of the year (optional). Defaults to the datepicker default which is usually standard English.

example.desc: Extract a date in ISO format.
Extract a date in expanded French format.

function.name: formatDate
function.desc: Format a date into a string value with a specified format.
function.longdesc: The format can be combinations of the following: * d - day of month (no leading zero) * dd - day of month (two digit) * D - day name short * DD - day name long * m - month of year (no leading zero) * mm - month of year (two digit) * M - month name short * MM - month name long * y - year (two digit) * yy - year (four digit) * '...' - literal text * '' - single quote * anything else - literal text '''Since v3.1.'''

params.name: format
params.desc: The format to use in presenting the date.

params.name: date
params.desc: The date value to be displayed.

params.name: dayNamesShort
params.desc: The short names for the days of the week, starting at Sunday (optional). Defaults to the datepicker default which is usually standard English.

params.name: dayNames
params.desc: The long names for the days of the week, starting at Sunday (optional). Defaults to the datepicker default which is usually standard English.

params.name: monthNamesShort
params.desc: The short names for the months of the year (optional). Defaults to the datepicker default which is usually standard English.

params.name: monthNames
params.desc: The long names for the months of the year (optional). Defaults to the datepicker default which is usually standard English.

example.desc: Display the date in ISO format. Produces '2007-01-26'.
Display the date in expanded French format. Produces 'Samedi, Juillet 14, 2007'.

function.name: iso8601Week
function.desc: Determine the week of the year for a given date: 1 to 53.
function.longdesc:
This function uses the ISO 8601 definition of a week: weeks start on a Monday and the first week of the year contains January 4. This means that up to three days from the previous year may be included in the first week of the current year, and that up to three days from the current year may be included in the last week of the previous year.
'''Since v3.1.'''

params.name: date
params.desc: The date to find the week for.

example.desc: Find the week of the year for a date.

function.name: dialog
function.desc: Make the selected elements Dialog boxes.

params.name: options
params.desc: A set of key/value pairs that configure the dialog. All options are optional.

option.name: buttons
option.desc: Specifies which buttons should be displayed on the dialog. The property key is the text of the button. The value is the callback function for when the button is clicked.

option.name: height
option.desc: The height of the dialog, in pixels. Default value: 200.

option.name: position
option.desc: Specifies where the dialog should be displayed. Possible values: 'center'. Default value: 'center'.

option.name: title
option.desc: Specifies the title of the dialog. The title can also be specified by the title attribute on the dialog source element.

option.name: width
option.desc: The width of the dialog, in pixels. Default value: 300.

example.desc: A simple jQuery UI Modal Dialog.
example.html: I'm in a dialog!

function.name: dialogOpen
function.desc: Opens the specified dialog boxes.

function.name: dialogClose
function.desc: Closes the specified dialog boxes.

function.name: slider
function.desc: Makes a slider from the nodeset supplied by the query.
function.longdesc: With this plugin, you can generate sliders with a wide range of options, including multiple handles, callbacks and more.

params.name: options
params.desc: A set of key/value pairs that configure the slider. All options are optional, but a slider will not be useful without at least one callback.

option.name: handle
option.desc: The jquery selector to use for the handle of the slider (defaults to ".ui-slider-handle").

option.name: minValue
option.desc: The minimum value of the slider. Useful for tracking values via callback, and to set steps.

option.name: maxValue
option.desc: The maximum value of the slider. Useful for tracking values via callback, and to set steps.

option.name: startValue
option.desc: The value the handle will have first.

option.name: stepping
option.desc: If defined, the new value has to be dividable through this number, so the slider jumps from step to step.

option.name: steps
option.desc: Alternative to stepping, this defines how many steps a slider will have, instead of how many values to jump, as in stepping.

option.name: axis
option.desc: Usually you don't have to set that option, because the slider finds out automatically if you want a horizontal or a vertical slider. In case it's not correctly detected, insert 'horizontal'/'vertical'.

option.name: stop
option.desc: Function that gets called when the user stops sliding. Takes arguments e and ui, for event and user-interface respectively. Use ui.value (single-handled sliders) or ui.values (multi-handled sliders) to obtain the value of the slider.

option.name: start
option.desc: Function that gets called when the user starts sliding. Takes arguments e and ui, for event and user-interface respectively. Use ui.value (single-handled sliders) or ui.values (multi-handled sliders) to obtain the value of the slider.

option.name: slide
change
option.desc: Function that gets called on slide stop, but only if the slider position has changed. Takes arguments e and ui, for event and user-interface respectively. Use ui.value (single-handled sliders) or ui.values (multi-handled sliders) to obtain the value of the slider.

example.desc: A simple jQuery UI Accordion.

function.name: tablesorter
function.desc: Create a sortable table with multi-column sorting capabilities.

params.name: options
params.desc: A set of key/value pairs that configure tablesorter. All options are optional.

option.name: cssHeader
option.desc: A string of the class name to be appended to sortable tr elements in the thead of the table.

option.name: cssAsc
option.desc: A string of the class name to be appended to sortable tr elements in the thead on a ascending sort.

option.name: cssDesc
option.desc: A string of the class name to be appended to sortable tr elements in the thead on a descending sort.

option.name: sortMultisortKey
option.desc: A string of the multi-column sort key.

option.name: textExtraction
option.desc: A string of the text-extraction method to use. For complex HTML structures inside td cell set this option to "complex", on large tables the complex option can be slow.

option.name: headers
option.desc: An object of instructions for per-column controls.

option.name: sortList
option.desc: An array of instructions for per-column sorting and direction in the format: [columnIndex, sortDirection] where columnIndex is a zero-based index for your columns left-to-right and sortDirection is 0 for Ascending and 1 for Descending.

option.name: sortForce
option.desc: Use to add an additional forced sort that will be appended to the dynamic selections by the user. For example, can be used to sort people alphabetically after some other user-selected sort that results in rows with the same value like dates or money due. It can help prevent data from appearing as though it has a random secondary sort.

option.name: widthFixed
option.desc: Indicates if tablesorter should apply fixed widths to the table columns. This is useful for the Pager companion. Requires the jQuery dimension plugin to work.

option.name: cancelSelection
option.desc: Indicates if tablesorter should disable selection of text in the table header (TH). Makes header behave more like a button.

option.name: debug
option.desc: Enables debugging mode, useful for development.

example.desc: A simple Table Sorter.
example.html:
First Name Last Name Age Total Discount Date
Peter Parker 28 $9.99 20% Jul 6, 2006 8:14 AM
John Hood 33 $19.99 25% Dec 10, 2002 5:14 AM
Clark Kent 18 $15.89 44% Jan 12, 2003 11:14 AM
Bruce Almighty 45 $153.19 44% Jan 18, 2001 9:12 AM
Bruce Evans 22 $13.19 11% Jan 18, 2007 9:12 AM

function.name: tabs
function.desc: The method that you use to create a new tabs interface.

params.name: initial
params.desc: An integer specifying the position of the tab (no zero-based index) that is selected on initialization.

params.name: options
params.desc: A set of key/value pairs that configures the tabs interface. All options are optional.

option.name: event
option.desc: The type of event to be used for selecting a tab.

option.name: disabled
option.desc: An array containing the position of the tabs (no zero-based index) that should be disabled on initialization.

option.name: cookie
option.desc: Retrieve the active tab to start with from a cookie. Requires cookie plugin. The object needs to have key/value pairs of the form the cookie plugin expects as options. Available options: { expires: 7, path: '/', domain: 'jquery.com', secure: true }

option.name: unselected
option.desc: Wether or not to start with all tabs unselected.

option.default: false, as the case may be unselected is enabled true
option.name: unselect
option.desc: Wether or not to hide an already selected tab on click.

option.name: spinner
option.desc: The HTML content of this string is shown in a tab title while remote content is loading. Pass in empty string to deactivate that behavior.

option.name: cache
option.desc: Wether or not to cache remote tabs content, e.g. load only once or with every click. Cached content is being lazy loaded, e.g once on the first click. Note that to prevent the actual Ajax requests from being cached by the browser you need to provide an extra cache: false flag to ajaxOptions.

option.name: ajaxOptions
option.desc: Additional Ajax options to consider when loading tab content (see $.ajax).

option.name: idPrefix
option.desc: If the remote tab, its anchor element that is, has no title attribute to generate an id from, an id/fragment identifier is created from this prefix and a unique id returned by $.data(el), for example "ui-tabs-54".

option.name: fxFade
option.desc: Wether or not to use fade in/out animations for tabs showing/hiding. Can be combined with fxSlide. Will overrule fxShow/fxHide.

option.name: fxSlide
option.desc: Wether or not to use slide down/up animations for tabs showing/hiding. Can be combined with fxFade. Will overrule fxShow/fxHide.

option.name: fxShow
option.desc: Key/value pairs of the form jQuery's animate function expects for creating a custom animation to show a tab. Unlike fxFade or fxSlide this animation is independent from optional fxHide.

option.name: fxHide
option.desc: Key/value pairs of the form jQuery's animate function expects for creating a custom animation to hide a tab. Unlike fxFade or fxSlide this animation is independent from optional fxShow.

option.name: fxSpeed
option.desc: A string representing one of the three predefined speeds ("slow", "normal", "fast") or the duration in milliseconds to run an animation.

option.name: fxShowSpeed
option.desc: A string representing one of the three predefined speeds ("slow", "normal", "fast") or the duration in milliseconds to run a show animation (fxFade, fxSlide, fxShow).

option.name: fxHideSpeed
option.desc: A string representing one of the three predefined speeds ("slow", "normal", "fast") or the duration in milliseconds to run a hide animation (fxFade, fxSlide, fxHide).

option.name: add
option.desc: Tab added callback, called with two arguments: added tab, added tab container (in this order).

option.name: remove
option.desc: Tab removed callback, called with two arguments: removed tab, removed tab container (in this order).

option.name: enable
option.desc: Tab enabled callback, called with two arguments: enabled tab, enabled tab container (in this order).

option.name: disable
option.desc: Tab disabled callback, called with two arguments: disabled tab, disabled tab container (in this order).

option.name: click
option.desc: Tab clicked callback, called with three arguments: clicked tab, tab container to show, tab container to hide (in this order). If callback returns false the tab click is aborted.

option.name: show
option.desc: Tab shown callback, called with three arguments: clicked tab, tab container to show, tab container to hide (in this order).

option.name: hide
option.desc: Tab hidden callback, called with three arguments: clicked tab, tab container to hide, tab container to show (in this order).

option.name: load
option.desc: Remote tab content loaded callback, called with two arguments: clicked, e.g. loading tab, loaded tab content container (in this order).

option.name: tabTemplate
option.desc: HTML template from which a new tab is created and added with the tabsAdd method. The placeholders #{href} and #{text} are replaced with the url and tab title that are passed as arguments to the tabsAdd method.

option.name: panelTemplate
option.desc: HTML template from which a new tab panel is created in case of adding a tab with the tabsAdd method or when creating a panel for a remote tab on the fly.

example.desc: A simple jQuery UI Tabbed pane.
example.html:
• One
  • Two
  • Three

First tab is active by default:

$('#example > ul').tabs();
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit, sed diam nonummy nibh euismod tincidunt ut laoreet dolore magna aliquam erat volutpat. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit, sed diam nonummy nibh euismod tincidunt ut laoreet dolore magna aliquam erat volutpat.
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit, sed diam nonummy nibh euismod tincidunt ut laoreet dolore magna aliquam erat volutpat. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit, sed diam nonummy nibh euismod tincidunt ut laoreet dolore magna aliquam erat volutpat. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit, sed diam nonummy nibh euismod tincidunt ut laoreet dolore magna aliquam erat volutpat.

example.desc: Builds a tabs interface with second tab selected on initialization.
Builds a tabs interface with some additional options.
Builds a tabs interface with second tab selected on initialization and some additional options.

function.name: tabsAdd
function.desc: The method that you use to add a new tab to a tabs interface.
function.longdesc: The selector must be the same as the one that was used for tabs initialisation, e.g. must match or can be the ul/ol element.

params.name: url
params.desc: A fragment identifier (hash) or full URL (same domain) for the new tab. The identifier may refer to an already existing element, otherwise a new div is going to be created.

params.name: title
params.desc: The title of the new tab.

params.name: position
params.desc: The position where the new tab is created (no zero-based index). By default a new tab is appended as last tab.

example.desc: Adds a new inline tab at the end.
Inserts a new inline tab at the second position.
Adds a new remote tab at the end.

function.name: tabsRemove
function.desc: The method that you use to remove a tab from a tabs interface.
function.longdesc: The selector must be the same as the one that was used for tabs initialisation, e.g. must match or can be the ul/ol element.

params.name: position
params.desc: The position of the tab that is going to be removed (no zero-based index).

function.name: tabsEnable
function.desc: The method that you use to enable a tab in a tabs interface.
function.longdesc: The selector must be the same as the one that was used for tabs initialisation, e.g. must match or can be the ul/ol element.

params.name: position
params.desc: The position of the tab that is going to be enabled (no zero-based index).

function.name: tabsDisable
function.desc: The method that you use to disable a tab in a tabs interface.
function.longdesc: The selector must be the same as the one that was used for tabs initialisation, e.g. must match or can be the ul/ol element.

params.name: position
params.desc: The position of the tab that is going to be disabled (no zero-based index).

function.name: tabsClick
function.desc: The method that you use to simulate a click on tab in a tabs interface.
function.longdesc: The selector must be the same as the one that was used for tabs initialisation, e.g. must match or can be the ul/ol element.

params.name: position
params.desc: The position of the tab that is going to be clicked (no zero-based index).

function.name: tabsLoad
function.desc: The method that you use to reload a remote (Ajax) tab in a tabs interface.
function.longdesc: The selector must be the same as the one that was used for tabs initialisation, e.g. must match or can be the ul/ol element.

params.name: position
params.desc: The position of the tab that is going to be reloaded (no zero-based index).

params.name: url
params.desc: A URL the content of the tab is loaded from. The given URL is also set for subsequent loads, until a new URL is specified that is.

function.name: tabsHref
function.desc: The method that you use to set a new URL for a remote (Ajax) tab in a tabs interface.
function.longdesc: The selector must be the same as the one that was used for tabs initialisation, e.g. must match or can be the ul/ol element.

params.name: position
params.desc: The position of the tab which remote URL, e.g. href, is going to be updated (no zero-based index).

params.name: url
params.desc: A URL the content of the tab is loaded from.

function.name: tabsSelected
function.desc: Retrieve the position of the currently selected tab of the first matched tabs interface (no zero-based index).
function.longdesc: The selector must be the same as the one that was used for tabs initialisation, e.g. must match or can be the ul/ol element. Returns -1 if no tab is currently selected.

function.name: tabsRotate
function.desc: A method that you use to set up an automatic rotation through tabs of a tab pane.
function.longdesc: The selector must be the same as the one that was used for tabs initialisation, e.g. must match or can be the ul/ol element. Rotation stops if a tab is clicked on. To stop the rotation programmatically call this method without any or some falsy argument, like 0 or null.

params.name: milliseconds
params.desc: Amount of time in milliseconds until the next tab in the cycle gets activated.

example.desc: Start rotation with an interval of 5 seconds.
Stop rotation.

function.name: shadow
function.desc: Add a drop shadow to the matched elements.

params.name: options
params.desc: A set of key/value pairs that configure the shadow. All options are optional.

option.name: color
option.desc: The color of the drop shadow.

option.name: offset
option.desc: How far away the drop shadow is positioned from the element, in pixels.

option.name: opacity
option.desc: How transparent to make the drop shadow.

example.desc: Adds a drop shadow to the example element.

function.name: shadowDestroy
function.desc: Destroys all shadows attached to the current jQuery elements.
function.longdesc: Destroys all shadows on the current elements. Cannot be reverted.

function.name: shadowEnable
function.desc: Enables shadows.
function.longdesc: Re-enables shadows on the jQuery supplied that has been disabled before.

function.name: shadowDisable
function.desc: Disables shadows.
function.longdesc: Temporarily disables shadows on the current jQuery. Can be re-enabled again later on.

function.name: magnifier
function.desc: Make the contents of the selected elements magnify upon mouse proximity.

params.name: options
params.desc: A set of key/value pairs that configure the magnifier. All options are optional.

option.name: baseline
option.desc: The direction in which the element will rise. Set to -1 to make the element rise up.

option.name: distance
option.desc: How far away the mouse needs to be, in pixels, before it begins having an effect on the element.

option.name: magnification
option.desc: The factor by which the element will be magnified when the mouse is completely over it.

option.name: opacity
option.desc: The minimum and maximum opacity that an element transitions inbetween (the maximum opacity will be set when the mouse is completely over the element).

option.name: overlap
option.desc: Allow the magnified elements to overlap each other, as opposed to pushing each other out of the way.

option.name: zIndex
option.desc: The index that the active element takes.

option.name: click
option.desc:
This function is called when the user clicks on one of the magnified items.
The argument e is the (click) event.
The argument ui is an object with three properties:
  • options (ui.options)
    A copy of the options set for this magnifier
  • current (ui.current)
    The DOM element clicked
  • currentOffset (ui.currentOffset)
    • The offset object of the clicked DOM element. (This saves the overhead of reprocessing the element's .offset() .) Offset object has two properties, top and left, which give the offset relative to the body.

example.desc: Makes the images in the block magnify on mouse move.

function.name: magnifierInstance
function.desc: Returns the OO instance of the current magnifier.
function.longdesc: For the advanced, this function is very useful to modify internals of the magnifier after initializing it. It returns a javascript function instance.

function.name: magnifierDestroy
function.desc: Destroys all magnifier functionality in the current jQuery.
function.longdesc: Destroys all magnifier functionality in the current jQuery.

function.name: magnifierReset
function.desc: Resets the magnifying on a magnified set of elements.
function.longdesc: This option resets the magnification to zero on the current set. It's very useful if you want to have another effect on click, for example.

function.name: magnifierEnable
function.desc: Enables magnifying.
function.longdesc: Re-enables magnifying on the jQuery supplied that has been disabled before.

function.name: magnifierDisable
function.desc: Disables magnification.
function.longdesc: Temporarily disables magnification on the current jQuery. Can be re-enabled again later on.
